subject: JAM*Tester
msgSnippet: Hello JUnit Community, My name is David Poll.  I m a 16-year-old high school student at Troy High School, in Fullerton, CA (Class of 05).  Over the past half-
messageBody:
Hello JUnit Community,

My name is David Poll. I'm a 16-year-old high school student at Troy
High School, in Fullerton, CA (Class of '05). Over the past half-
year or so, I have been working with my AP Computer Science teacher,
Dave Wittry, on a project to make JUnit testing more accessible to
both teachers and students called JAM*Tester (JUnit Auto-Matic
Tester).

We just recently released the Student Version of our tool, which may
be useful to more than just students. Its goal is to aid in the
creation of JUnit TestCases. It also runs the tests and reports
JUnit results. Additionally, it provides some code-coverage
reporting, which can be extremely useful (fyi: code-coverage provided
in part by Clover http://www.thecortex.net/clover).

Additionally, we have the Teacher Version of the tool. The idea
behind this is that a Teacher can create a battery of tests for their
students' labs (possibly using the Student Version), and then
automatically compile and run the tests for all of their students at
once.

If you're interested, please come to our website,
http://www.jamtester.com We would appreciate any feedback you may
have for us.

Thanks in advance for your support,
David
